meanings.sent1: In the olden days, people used a bawbee to buy sweets.
meanings.sent2: I found a bawbee in the dusty corner of the drawer.
meanings.sent3: The bawbee rolled under the couch and played hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The bawbee gleamed like a tiny sun in the palm of his hand.
meanings.sent5: The children's eyes widened at the shiny bawbee.

meanings.sent1: She saved every bawbee she earned from chores.
meanings.sent2: I only have a bawbee left for my bus fare.
meanings.sent3: He joked that a bawbee wouldn't even buy a cup of tea.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams cost more than a bawbee could ever buy.
meanings.sent5: The bawbee felt lighter than a feather in his pocket.
